data.title: Wonderkids in FM 2009
data.meta_description: There is advanced list of Football Manager 2009 wondekids like Hugo Lloris, Davide Santon, Gareth Bale, Jack Rodwell, Ignacio Camacho, Rafael Carioca, Alex...
data.text:

It does feel better finding them on your own, but once regens start coming in I find it more or less impossible (using the in game scouting) to find world class ones as even with 20/20 scouts you can't be guaranteed their reports are correct. Plus, even if you send them to say Africa, they never find anyone, yet if you use Genie Scout or whatever there's always about 5 African regens with 180+ PA.

It does feel better finding them on your own, but once regens start coming in I find it more or less impossible (using the in game scouting) to find world class ones as even with 20/20 scouts you can't be guaranteed their reports are correct. Plus, even if you send them to say Africa, they never find anyone, yet if you use Genie Scout or whatever there's always about 5 African regens with 180+ PA.

X|

How many scouts do you know from England that could drop down to Africa for a week and instantly find world class players... It is an entire continent.

A good mixture of scouting reports and trial days should be more than adequate a resource to decide how you feel about a player.

Furthermore, 'Stats' don't make a player, there is personality and team morale to consider, no?

Player X: SUPER WORLD CLASS WONDER KID (controversial personality)

Player Y: Above-Average League Player (professional personality)

I can not understand why some people would choose the wonderkid and sacrifice team harmony.

Well considering this "Scouting Knowledge" is supposed to show how successful your scouts will be in a certain area, then I'd expect any scout with exceptional knowledge of Africa to find at least one out of five wonderkids.

Also, I'd rather have player X than player Y because 1: simply he's a world class player and 2: that's what the tutoring is for, to change young players whose attitude isn't right.

Well considering this "Scouting Knowledge" is supposed to show how successful your scouts will be in a certain area, then I'd expect any scout with exceptional knowledge of Africa to find at least one out of five wonderkids.

Also, I'd rather have player X than player Y because 1: simply he's a world class player and 2: that's what the tutoring is for, to change young players whose attitude isn't right.

The game manual says that there are some mental attributes, which can not be changed. These are the attributes I'm discussing.

I understand what you mean about having a world class player, but world class over above average and sacrificing my team morale seems to much of a gamble for my lowly sides.
